pronunciation: CONCUBINE, [Latin , to lie together, to lie down.]

definitions.text:
1. A woman who cohabits with man, without authority of legal marriage; woman kept for lewd purposes; kept mistress.
2. A wife of inferior condition; lawful wife, but not united man by usual ceremonies, and of inferior condition. Such were Hagar and Keturah, concubines of Abraham; and such concubines were allowed by Roman laws.
